formattedAddress: 20 Warren St, New York, NY 10007, USA
adrFormatAddress: 20 Warren St, New York, NY 10007, USA

originalText.text: Visiting icca for their Italian Japanese tasting course was an experience I won’t forget. It was a perfect blend of pure enjoyment and focused culinary excellence, leaving me no time to take photo but only enjoy the food. Each dish brought a sense of joy and contentment, making the entire meal not just delicious but truly memorable. I’ve found myself reflecting on this experience multiple times over the past year. It was more than just a meal; it was a delightful journey that left me feeling genuinely happy. Highly recommend for a special dining experience!

text.text: Visiting icca for their Italian Japanese tasting course was an experience I won’t forget. originalText.text: My friend an I went for the Italian Kappo. The staff was awesome. We chose to do the sale pairing and they introduced each and every one. (I’m not a huge fan of dry sake, I like more on the sweeter side. Hence they asked the chef for a replacement for one of the sakes. Very considerate). We had a very nice conversation with the staff and the food was amazing. None of the dishes were a disappointment. We are looking to come back to try their omakase.

originalText.text:
I had a wonderful omakase experience at Icca. Great seasonal selections and preparations were done by Chef Kazu and the sous-chef. All staff members are friendly and approachable as well. Learned a lot about the food served from the chef and the staff.

Memorable items: smoked young tuna, abalone liver sauce nigiri, rock fish shabu shabu, sea urchin nigiri.

text.text:

Memorable items: smoked young tuna, abalone liver sauce nigiri, rock fish shabu shabu, sea urchin nigiri.

originalText.text:
If you are not familiar with the area, you may miss the small entrance and don’t find a door, like me. You know Japanese things (people, food, road, etc.) are always small.
However, the food is amazing. It’s a combination of Italian and Japanese but also an art. I had three green source, and all of them are different.

text.text:
If you are not familiar with the area, you may miss the small entrance and don’t find a door, like me. You know Japanese things (people, food, road, etc.) are always small.
However, the food is amazing. It’s a combination of Italian and Japanese but also an art. I had three green source, and all of them are different.

originalText.text:
We came here for the omakase at the sushi counter. It was about 400/person prepaid in advanced. It seats about 8 people around the counter giving a private experience. Expect about 20 + dishes and spending 3 hours there.

The staff was attentive and ready to help. The chef was friendly and would occasionally engage in small talk.

I was initially worried about how much Italian influence there would be but it was unfounded. The hairy crab pasta was amazing!

Overall, the food was amazing. The fish was fresh. The abalone liver was bomb. The uni was very creamy. I really enjoyed my time there and would go back again next time Im here.
